subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] keyboard/lexical set proposal
msgSnippet: ... The only half-letters I have trouble with are half-Way and the would-be half-Why, although there are cases where I avoid the others too, especially before
messageBody:
On 18.12.2007 Moira O'Brien wrote:
> hello Benkt
>
> I am afraid i cant agree with your "new" suggestions:
>
> alternate #21 does not aid connection as the only
> connection points are then at the top line
>
> half #7 would not be easily identifiable imho
>
> half #17 is a standard senior alternative
>
> As a general note on half letters, when using then in
> writing I tend to look at the readability of the words. If
> the use of the half letter makes the word harder to read,
> I generally dont use it.
>

The only half-letters I have trouble with are half-Way and
the would-be half-Why, although there are cases where I
avoid the others too, especially before It!, which goes to
show how, as I said, people's appreciation of these things
varies. That's one of the reasons I don't think half-letters
and alternate letters should be used in typographic QS, any
more than the four variants of _s_ (unconnected, connected
to the left, connected to the right and connected both left
and right) used in italic handwriting are reproduced in
italic fonts.

/BP 8^)>
--
Benct Philip Jonsson -- melroch atte melroch dotte se
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
No man forgets his original trade: the rights of
nations and of kings sink into questions of grammar,
if grammarians discuss them.
-Dr. Samuel Johnson (1707 - 1784)
